summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 discussing logistical coordination for FBI interviews with potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It involves a Victim Specialist and other personnel arranging availability to meet with victims after scheduled interviews in Miami.

persons.name: Victim Specialist Federal Bureau of Investigation Miami Headquarter City and Homestead Resident Agency
persons.context: Sent an email on July 10, 2019, acknowledging an update regarding potential Epstein victims and providing a legal disclaimer about the email's confidentiality.

connections.person2: Victim Specialist Federal Bureau of Investigation Miami Headquarter City and Homestead Resident Agency
connections.description: Both are involved in coordinating victim services and interviews related to the Epstein investigation, as evidenced by their email correspondence.

events.title: Scheduled victim interviews
events.description: FBI interviews with potential Epstein victims were scheduled for 11 AM and 3 PM in Miami.

events.title: Case Agent travel to Florida
events.description: The FBI Case Agent was reported to be heading to Florida to conduct interviews related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: FBI interviews with potential Epstein victims were actively being scheduled and coordinated as of July 2019.
The email chain shows logistical planning for victim support services around the time of interviews.
The correspondence includes a standard FBI confidentiality disclaimer regarding the protection of Personally Identifiable Information (PII).
Multiple email participants are redacted or only identified by initials, indicating sensitive law enforcement communication.
